answers.answer: I just finished 12 weeks of sovaldi and ribavirin on April 22 and had no side effects. I cross country skied 35 days this winter and rode my bike 650 miles in two weeks, including a 100 mile ride during vacation in Florida all while on treatment. I'm not sure about the simeprevir in terms of side effects but from what I have been reading here it doesn't sound like there is much difference. I was expecting something from the ribavirin after reading about all the potential side effects but it never happened. I think for many it has to do with how damaged one's liver is and how healthy one is going in to treatment. If you are fit and healthy you should be fine. Keep up the exercise as much as you can it will help you mentally and physically. Best of luck during treatment and after...think SVR!

I was running 3-5 miles a day before I started treatment.  I felt great.  I used treatment as an excuse to stop.  That was a big mistake.I suggest you continue to exercise but not as rigorously as before treatment.

I am hoping to keep active - my current regimen is a kind of insanity version that a b'ball alum from our university NCAA team started.  It has lots of interval work and keeps us all motivated with great music and a spirit of shared purpose.  Many in the group are over 50, fighting diabetes, obesity, cancer, and, in my case, HCV.  Some days I absolutely have to take a nap after class, but so be it.

question: Haven't started sof/sim tx yet.  Curious if you think keeping up with regular exercise program will be too tough?  With what I've read here and elsewhere about aches, pains, fatigue -- is there too little energy left to use it up rather thar daily chores, work, family, etc., until tx is over?
title: Exercise during tx
